intro: Erysimum echinellum, commonly known as the prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Erysimum echinellum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
